thread.title: South Street Seaport Museum lands millions for Sandy repairs
thread.title_full: South Street Seaport Museum lands millions for Sandy repairs

author: David A. Arnott
title: South Street Seaport Museum lands millions for Sandy repairs
text:
South Street Seaport Museum lands millions for Sandy repairs Aug 14, 2015, 3:00pm EDT Industries & Tags David A. Arnott Assistant News Editor Home of the Day Harvey Barrison | cc-licensed. https://flic.kr/p/bUF1mU The South Street Seaport Museum before Hurricane Sandy, in 2012. (Photo by Harvey… more The federal government has awarded $10.4 million to the South Street Seaport Museum for repairs after Hurricane Sandy, nearly three years after flood waters badly damaged the building. Previously, the museum had said it would require $22 million to make all necessary repairs , DNAinfo New York reported, and it’s not yet clear if the museum will request more money. So far, it has reopened its throwback printing shop at 209 Water Street and still managed to run a few other programs, the report said. However, with major water damage to electrical systems, DNAinfo said, the museum has been unable to reopen galleries that remained out of the water’s reach. Just weeks ago, a benefit concert for the museum featuring Duran Duran and Wyclef Jean was cancelled under mysterious circumstances , with the museum claiming an unspecified technical issue, the New York Times reported at the time. That would have been the first fundraising event for the museum since the storm, the report said.
